[B][COLOR accent_color]Version $INFO[System.AddonVersion(skin.fentastic)][/COLOR][/B] - Fixed ratings not showing on some items - Readded Embuary Helper/Info functionality to Video Info window
[COLOR red][B]Please make sure to clear the ratings cache and restart Kodi before trying to fetch ratings again.[/B][/COLOR]
[B][COLOR accent_color]Version 1.0.21[/COLOR][/B] - Switched ratings source to MDbList for better tvshow support (enter MDbList API Key in Skin settings to activate) - Created Ratings section in Skin settings - Added on/off toggles for individual ratings - Added high quality icons for ratings - Added optional one-click trailers (requires MDbList API Key) - Added IMDb popular ratings. These are from IMDb's most popular movies and tvshows. The rating for these is out of 100. The color coding of the new flame icon is as follows:
• [COLOR blueviolet][B]PURPLE[/B][/COLOR] flame = Top 10 • [COLOR deeppink][B]PINK[/B][/COLOR] flame = Top third (10 - 33) • [COLOR darkorange][B]ORANGE[/B][/COLOR] flame = Middle third (33 - 66) • [COLOR dodgerblue][B]BLUE[/B][/COLOR] flame = Bottom third (66 - 100)
[B]IMPORTANT: After you have entered in your MDbList API key, I HIGHLY recommend clicking the "Clear ratings cache" button in Skin settings and then restarting Kodi before trying to fetch new ratings again. If you do not do this you may run into errors. This is a one time thing that will minimize the possibility of running into issues related to the switch to MDbList.[/B]
- Added optional one-click close of Kodi via the homescreen power button. If you decide to use this you can still access the shutdown menu by holding the back key/backspace on your remote/keyboard. - Other changes/fixes
[B][COLOR accent_color]Version 1.0.20[/COLOR][/B] - Fixed crashing bug. You can now enable ReuseLanguageInvoker in FEN. - Added overlay for background media playback - Added network sources for choosing of custom background - Removed [B]Tip: Crashes[/B] window

[B][COLOR accent_color]Version 1.0.18[/COLOR][/B] - Small bug fix

[B][COLOR accent_color]Version 1.0.4[/COLOR][/B]
[B]IMPORTANT NOTICE: IF YOUR WIDGETS WERE DELETED AFTER THIS UPDATE PLEASE READ INFO BELOW
In this version the default widgets that you may have seen on first install have been removed. In order to avoid possible future conflicts and/or errors, please go to Skin settings » Main menu items » click Remake Menus and Widgets. This will remove the default widgets if any and remake the ones you have already set up. If you didn't set up any widgets on first install, and all of your widgets were deleted, go back into Skin settings » Main menu items in order to set up your widgets. See Setup Guide for help setting up your widgets. This is a one-time thing and will not be necessary for future updates.[/B]

include.name: SetupGuide
include.label:
[B][COLOR accent_color]Welcome to the FENtastic Setup Guide[/COLOR][/B]
FENtastic is a skin specifically designed for FEN users. It can display movie, tvshow, and episode widgets as well as submenu widgets. It can also set paths for main menu items (more on this later). Here in this guide I will show you how these work and how to set them up.
On first install the home screen should be empty. This means that the Movie and Show sections should be missing from the main menu on the left.
Now lets go set up the widgets. From this dialog screen click Back on your remote or Backspace if you are using a keyboard. Here you'll see a group of menu items on the left. Navigate up to Main menu items. Here is where we will set up the widgets.
Click a menu item to toggle the display of a section on and off. This will show or hide the section on the home screen. Now toggle the Movie/Show section to 'on'. You'll see a couple of menu items drop down. They are set main menu path and set widgets.
[B][COLOR deeppink]- Set main menu path[/COLOR][/B] is for setting up the path when clicking on the Movie/Show section in the main menu on the left side of the home screen. You can set this to whatever you path you like within FEN. I like to set mine to my Trakt movie/tvshow collection.
[B][COLOR deeppink]- Set widgets[/COLOR][/B] is for setting up the movie/tvshow widgets. These are the main widgets that you'll set up. You can configure up to 10 movie and 10 TV show widgets. After choosing a path you'll have the option to set the label and display type (Poster, Landscape, LandscapeInfo, and Category) for each widget. If you choose the Category display type, you'll have the option to set it up as a stacked widget. After that you can choose the display type for the stacked widget as well.
[B][COLOR accent_color]Stacked widgets[/COLOR][/B] contain a category widget and a normal widget beneath. The category widget "communicates" with the normal widget in order to load the new widget list according to the focused item in the category widget. If the stacked widget that you set up has 20 items in it, then that means you'll be able to have all 20 widgets available from just one widget on the home screen.
That's it! You're all set to go. Enjoy the skin!
If you would like to see a more detailed version of this Setup Guide, please visit my Github repo at https://github.com/ivarbrandt/skin.fentastic
